text: Occupational and personal pensions, properly regulated, will continue to offer security for middle and high earners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue discussions on annuity reform to ensure tax rules do not unnecessarily restrict the development of annuity products and markets.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For low- to middle-income earners, stakeholder pensions cap costs, guarantee value for money, offer flexibility, and drive down fees across the board.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And for the lowest paid and carers, full-time parents and people with disabilities, the state second pension will top up their pension contributions to give a decent pension in retirement to 18 million people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today’s pensioners have much to give to society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s NHS Plan offers £1. 4 billion of investment for older people to promote better health and support independence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pensioners also need simple, accessible services that treat them with dignity and promote independence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on Care Direct to provide a better integration of health, housing, benefits and social care for older people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This will be an integrated ‘third age service’ to help older people and those who care for them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Carers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Not only are the large majority of people who require care older, but also the majority of carers are older people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will tackle the problems faced by people requiring care and the problems of carers themselves.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The national carers strategy is the first step, with information, support and care for carers: Labour will spend £500 million over the next three years providing financial support for 300,000 carers through the benefits system, and £255 million for social care services for carers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: More is being done for carers through income support; carers will be better able to combine work and care; and 75,000 more carers each year are now able to take a break from their caring responsibilites.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are proud that, with Labour, care by qualified nurses will be made free to all, wherever it is received.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: One hundred and fifty thousand more older people will receive rehabilitation and convalescence through growing investment in the NHS and social services that the Tories refuse to match.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to see carers given access to the cash and services appropriate to their service to their relatives and the community.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Carers and Disabled Children’s Act gives carers a right to an independent assessment of their needs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will examine the development of a fund to help local authorities produce tailored care packages to back up the results of these assessments.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Social inclusion
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Social exclusion, affecting around ten per cent of the population, living in fewer than 1,000 of the most deprived wards in Britain, damages lives and wrecks communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Before 1997, social exclusion was ignored.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now we have a new approach – improving the quality of mainstream services, preventing people falling between the cracks, and reintegrating them into society if things go wrong.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have targeted five priorities:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Homelessness
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The number of people living on the streets is down by one third since 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s target is to cut rough sleeping to two-thirds of its 1998 level by 2002.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Beyond then, we will maintain the drive to keep the number as low as possible.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Teenage pregnancy rates are falling
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Yet Britain has the highest rates in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s strategy tackles the causes of teenage pregnancy, provides mothers under 18 with access to supervised housing if they cannot live at home, and ensures that, if they do have children, teenagers get access to training, education or work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2004 we are pledged to reduce teenage pregnancy by 15 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Truancy and exclusion.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has a target of reducing truancy and exclusion by a third by 2002.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The police are conducting truancy sweeps; parents are now subject to fines of up to £2,500; funds are being targeted towards pupils at risk.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 16- to 18-year-olds.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nearly ten per cent of 16- to 18-year-olds are not in education, training or work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The new Connexions service will bridge the gap, providing a single adviser to ensure all young people receive clear advice on the transition to work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Neighbourhood renewal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Over the next three years Labour is pledged to back reform, with £900 million of investment in deprived neighbourhoods.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want local people to lead renewal – a coalition of public, private and voluntary organisations specifying priorities, engaging local effort.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Local Strategic Partnerships, which we have introduced to help coordinate public service improvement, will be properly inclusive of local people, involving them in decision-making.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They will be backed by specific funds to engage the local community.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nearly £100 million has been set aside for business start-ups, and we will create a new tax credit for community investment to create £1 billion of investment in disadvantaged areas.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A popular welfare state
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s objective is to get the right benefit to the right people at the right time.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want those entitled to benefits to take up their rights to claim them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Fraud undermines confidence in the welfare system, so we are committed to reduce it.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have been prepared to be tough – preventing fraud by tightening gateways, sharpening sanctions on fraudsters, and now with ‘two-strikes-and-you’re-out’.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have saved £1 billion in fraud and error over the course of the Parliament by tightening up the way we administer income support.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The introduction of Automated Credit Transfer will save a further £100 million per year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to clear targets for fraud reduction for each benefit, including a commitment to halve the rate of fraud and error in income support and Job Seeker’s Allowance by 2006, and to incorporate fraud prevention into the design of new policies on benefits and tax credits.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are also committed to data sharing between government agencies and action to reduce to a minimum the number of ‘spare’ national insurance numbers that are a gateway to fraud.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our welfare state is underpinned by clear values – we help you to help yourself, we invest in children, we support our pensioners, we insist that no community be written off, and we minimise fraud and error.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our reforms will build a strong and inclusive society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: How Labour helps pensioners:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by boosting the basic state pension for a single pensioner to £77 each week in 2003, £123 for couples
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by retaining the Winter Fuel Payment, and free TV licences for over-75s
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by rewarding those who save with the Pension Credit
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by raising the Minimum Income Guarantee to £100 each week (£154 for couples) in 2003
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by tackling discrimination against over-50s in health care and in the workplace
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by boosting police numbers and cutting overall crime, and crimes like burglary that affect senior citizens most
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 4. Strong and safe communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goals:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Halve the burglary rate and double the chance of a persistent offender being caught and punished, as we modernise the criminal justice system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Reformed local government with higher-quality services, as we decentralise power.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our next steps
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - An extra 6,000 police recruits raising police numbers to their highest ever level.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Double the amount of assets seized from drug traffickers and other major criminals.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Increased sentences plus education and drug treatment for persistent offenders.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - A bill of rights for victims.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - New freedoms with new targets for local government.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We all know the sort of Britain we want to live in – a Britain where we can walk the streets safely and know our children are safe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have a ten-year vision: a new social contract where everyone has a stake based on equal rights, where they pay their dues by exercising responsibility in return, and where local communities shape their own futures.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Overall crime is down ten per cent in Labour Britain, recorded crime down seven per cent, and police numbers are now rising.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our strategy is clear and consistent – tough on crime and tough on the causes of crime.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goal of reducing crime depends on reform of the criminal justice system at every level, from police to courts to prison – to put crime reduction centre stage.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And, because crime is changing, crime fighting has to change too – to tackle repeat offending, drug-related crime and organised crime.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are investing to raise police numbers to their highest level ever.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Offenders must know they will be supervised in or out of prison until they can prove they have gone straight.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Safe communities reclaim their streets; then they can shape their own affairs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the 19th century, local politics was the motor for economic and social change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our purpose is simple: to create a Britain that is democratic, decentralised and diverse, with decisions always taken as close to the people as is consistent with efficiency and equity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goal is a new settlement with local government – over finance, structures and services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Responsibility from all – Winning the battle against crime
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Recorded crime doubled under the Conservatives: burglary went up 105 per cent, car crime 110 per cent, violent crime 182 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The number of offenders caught, convicted and punished fell.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The criminal justice system, especially for young offenders, was in disarray.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Anti-social behaviour was unchecked.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And investment was falling.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The British Crime Survey shows crime down ten per cent in Labour’s first two and a half years, including a four per cent drop in violent crime.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Recorded crime is down seven per cent from 1997, domestic burglary down 28 per cent, car crime down 20 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Investment in crime fighting is up.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have reversed the declining trend in police numbers, reformed youth justice, and supported every community to prevent crime and anti-social behaviour.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have reduced by seven weeks the time from arrest to sentence for persistent young offenders, and are on track to meet our pledge to halve the time by May 2002.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we are not satisfied.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Drug-related crime is a menace.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Recorded violent crime has risen, partly because more domestic and racial violence is being reported.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And new crimes are being committed – fraud through the internet, human trafficking.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The only way to reduce crime is by being tough on crime and tough on its causes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Government can help families and communities prevent crime.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But when people do commit crimes, we need an effective criminal justice system able to catch, punish and rehabilitate people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Supporting the police
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The foundation is our police force.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Police numbers started falling in 1993.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our investment in 2000-01 increased the number of recruits by an extra 3,000, boosting the number of officers in training by 77 per cent over the previous year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Now Labour pledges a further 6,000 extra recruits.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s pledge is that over the next three years annual funding for the police will rise by £1.6 billion, to £9.3 billion.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We also need to create a more effective police service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Basic command units are the heart of modern policing, and local commanders and senior detectives should be properly trained and rewarded.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Strong leadership, modern equipment and specialist training and expertise are all essential.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will bring in new arrangements for the development and appointment of chief officers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will introduce a new national core curriculum for officers at every level.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure that specialist detective expertise is built up using outside experts where necessary.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will ensure more people see more police in the community.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will discuss with the police how those on the frontline might be rewarded for their skills, experience and commitment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will promote co-operation across force boundaries for common services like training.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are also committed to a new independent police complaints commission.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Persistent offending
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: About 100,000 persistent offenders, mostly young men, commit about half of all serious crimes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need a new approach to catch, convict, punish and rehabilitate more of them:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Youth offending teams will track up to 2,500 of the most persistent young offenders 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Every active offender will be on the DNA database by 2004.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Persistent offending should lead to increased punishment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will end the failed policy of repeat financial penalties; where offending continues, firmer measures will be taken.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will invest over £200 million over three years to reduce reoffending by those in custody.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Sentences will combine time in prison and in the community, with proper supervision after release for ex-prisoners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In time, all offenders will have their own plan for return to lawful life, starting in custody with drug treatment or literacy training.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • New Review Courts will ensure that offenders who breach the conditions of their sentence will get extra community service, more intensive supervision or custody.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Those who break their bail can expect to go straight into custody for the remainder of their remand period.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • To deal with the most dangerous offenders of all – those with a dangerous severe personality disorder – we will pass new legislation and create over 300 more high-security prison and hospital places.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our proposals are based on a simple principle:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: stay straight or you will stay supervised or go back inside.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The continued modernisation of the probation, parole and prison services, so every offender gets punishment designed to minimise reoffending, will carry this forward.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on our youth justice reforms to improve the standard of custodial accommodation and offending programmes for 18- to 20-year-old offenders.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Crime in the community.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Broken windows, graffiti and litter all send a signal about lawlessness.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour supports fines for anti-social behaviour and new powers to tackle unruly behaviour and kerb crawlers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Every local authority should have an anti-social behaviour unit.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will tackle alcohol-related disorder, with an overhaul of licensing laws, greater flexibility over opening times, and tougher controls on rogue landlords.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also streamline the system for removal of untaxed and abandoned cars.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Crime fighting now starts in every community thanks to new statutory Crime and Disorder Partnerships.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our Safe Communities Fund will target hundreds of neighbourhoods with the highest crime rates with extra crime-fighting investment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Domestic violence accounts for at least a quarter of all violent crime, so Labour is committed to expanding the safe hostel network.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Crime prevention requires that those most at risk of falling into a life of crime – children excluded from school, teenagers leaving care – are given real help and opportunity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That includes drugs education for every child at primary and secondary school, and youth inclusion schemes in high-crime areas.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also take measures to tackle the problem of child pornography on the internet.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Drugs
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: One of the biggest contemporary drivers of crime is drugs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Access to effective treatment is essential.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Prisoners are already subject to compulsory testing and offered treatment where necessary, which has led to a 50 per cent cut in the number testing positive.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Drug Testing and Treatment Orders ensure people punished in the community stay drug-free.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are pledged to raise spending on drug treatment by 70 per cent by 2004.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will roll out drug testing to cover offenders at every stage of the system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: People in prison for drug-related offences will have to kick the habit before they are free from supervision on the outside.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Drug dealers will be required to register with the police after leaving prison.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will simplify the law on extradition to target organised crime including drug traffickers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Criminal Assets Recovery Agency will target their ill-gotten gains.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will follow the money trail, through bureaux de change to offshore accounts, to convict them, and remove their money and passports.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition is to mobilise every neighbourhood against drugs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will therefore ensure that crime-fighting partnerships, covering every locality, get over £200 million over the next three years to fight crime and drugs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A modern criminal justice system
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The UK’s legal traditions are precious.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But too much of our criminal law and the organisation of the courts are stuck in the past.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition is to re-equip the criminal justice system to deliver justice for all – the victims, the public and the defendant, with a short-term target of 100,000 more crimes ending in a criminal brought to justice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our White Paper Criminal Justice: The Way Ahead set out our initial views on reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Auld enquiry will also make major recommendations.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Prosecution
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Despite an increase of 25 per cent since 1997, we have too few prosecutors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2004, Labour pledges 300 new prosecutors, including specialists in areas like serious and organised crime, paid on a level playing field with the defence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will modernise and consolidate the whole criminal law system to promote public confidence and to speed up criminal proceedings.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Law reform is necessary to make provisions against corporate manslaughter.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Courts
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The current system, split between magistrates and crown courts, needs reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A unified system, including lower or intermediate tiers of court, offers simplicity and flexibility.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Lay magistrates as well as professional judges have their place in the system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will remove the widely abused right of defendants alone to dictate whether or not they should be tried in crown court.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For specialist cases such as those involving domestic violence or fraud, there is a strong case for specialist courts and specialist judges.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also develop late sitting, sevenday- a-week courts in high-crime areas to ensure there is no delay in getting people through the criminal justice system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have established a Judicial Commissioner to scrutinise the appointments process, and will take forward reform on the basis of experience.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Rules of evidence
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our rules of evidence fail to trust the good sense of judges and jurors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Recent case law has extended the admissibility of evidence of previous conduct.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: If there is any remaining doubt, we will consider legislation to reinforce the judgment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Pending the findings of the Auld report, we see a strong case for a new presumption that would allow evidence of previous convictions where relevant.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Currently only the prosecution must disclose all expert evidence and names of all witnesses.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the light of the Auld report, we will consider whether the defence should do so too.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In addition, witnesses should be able to refer to their original statements in the witness box, as well as offer evidence by video-link.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Representation
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have created the Community Legal Service and will extend it to 90 per cent of the population by April 2002.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to pursue the principle of best value for the benefit of the taxpayer and criminal defendants in the Criminal Defence Service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will examine reforms of the tribunal system in the light of the Leggatt Review.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will subject restrictive practices in the legal professions to the closest scrutiny to ensure both the professions and the courts serve the wider public interest.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Victims have rights
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997, victims were the forgotten people in legal battles.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That has begun to change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have more than doubled the funding for Victim Support, taken powers to protect vulnerable witnesses in court, and prevented personal cross-examination by the defendant of rape victims.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We now propose further action.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: First, victims will be given the legal right to present their views on the impact of the crime to the court and other criminal justice agencies before sentencing decisions.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Second, prosecutors will be able to challenge defence pleas in mitigation of the crime.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Third, we will legislate for a Victims’ Bill of Rights to give support, protection, and rights to information and compensation to victims.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our diverse nation
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour believes that Britain can be a model of a multicultural, multi-racial society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have made major legal change; now is the time to build the inclusive society in tune with British values.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our commitment to protection for every citizen is expressed in the 1998 Human Rights Act.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It ensures that British citizens are able to enforce rights in our own courts.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Other legal change was necessary too.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Race Relations (Amendment) Act learns the legal lessons from the shocking death of Stephen Lawrence and places a positive duty on all public bodies to promote equal opportunity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We abhor racism and shall continue to implement the recommendations of the Macpherson report, including the reform of the ‘double jeopardy’ law for murder.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The repeal of Section 28 of the 1988 Local Government Act was grossly misrepresented as an attempt to use teaching to promote particular lifestyles.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will ensure that such teaching continues to be prohibited, based on the provisions of the Learning and Skills Act, while removing discrimination on grounds of sexual orientation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The UK now has the most comprehensive anti-discrimination legislation in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But an inclusive, tolerant, open society, where people rise on their merits, depends on culture and action as well as law.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We now need to reduce the barriers – to services, opportunities, institutions – that still hold people back.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This applies in the public and private sectors.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There are too few black and Asian staff in key public services and, in almost all organisations, far too few in middle and senior grades.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This is why we now have targets for the diversity of central government and other public services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Voluntary and community organisations are key to Labour’s vision for Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: From large national charities to local community groups and faith-based institutions, these sectors are a vital and diverse part of national life.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have changed the tax rules to encourage individuals and businesses to give to charity, supported initiatives to increase volunteering, involved voluntary and community groups in the design and delivery of key government programmes like Sure Start, and helped charities build up their capacity to do their job even better.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will build on its Compact with the voluntary sector, as we develop more farreaching partnerships for the delivery of services and the renewal of our communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also build on our financial incentives for volunteering, by developing an effective infrastructure to support voluntary work in every community in Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We welcome the contribution of churches and other faith-based organisations as partners of local and central government in community renewal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will use a successor to the Lambeth Group to look at government’s interface with faith communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Immigration
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: People from abroad make a positive contribution to British society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: As our economy changes and expands, so our rules on immigration need to reflect the need to meet skills shortages.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The primary purpose rule, which split families and did nothing to stop abuse, has been ended.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A right of appeal for family visitors has been introduced.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: immigration rules will remain clear, firm and fair, and help ensure that those who come and work here continue to make a major contribution to our economic and social life.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Asylum
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is right that people fleeing persecution are able to make a new life as hard-working citizens in a new country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain has a long record of providing a home for such people, and it is important that we maintain this position.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But asylum should not be an alternative route to immigration.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The UK is ninth per head of population among European nations for asylum applications.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The key is to hear cases swiftly as well as fairly.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By cutting the decision time and increasing the processing of claims to over 10,000 a month, Labour has reduced the backlog we inherited.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have tightened controls against traffickers, and introduced a civil penalty for lorry drivers who bring in illegal immigrants.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A national support system has been introduced to relieve pressure on local authorities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Asylum seekers and their dependants whose claims are rejected will be removed from Britain with the aim of more than 30,000 in 2003-04.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also help those granted refugee status to integrate into the local community, supporting them so they can come off benefits and into work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support tough penalties for those who engage in the barbaric trade of human trafficking.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will bring forward proposals to ensure a common interpretation of the 1951 Convention across the EU and to improve the international response to regional crises.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Political renewal
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Change comes from the bottom up as much as the top down.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For the last 50 years, governments have failed to respect this basic truth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Local authorities are responsible for the effective delivery of over £90 billion of public services a year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The staff and councillors who work for the community often have the hardest jobs and their expertise is a real resource when it comes to achieving reform.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The best of local government is an inspiring example of what government can achieve.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour’s ambition is a partnership of mutual respect and mutual responsibility.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to combine additional rights and resources with responsibility and reform, working with councillors and officers to develop the structures, services and finance to help local communities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The job of local government is to provide the leadership to improve quality of life, and offer the citizen a seamless, one-stop service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have worked with local government to establish clear targets for standards of service; and to offer incentives for service improvement and innovation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Partnership with the voluntary and private sectors is key.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The foundation of effective service delivery is best value in every service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Year on year, local authorities and their staff will now work to achieve improvement in services, matching themselves against the best.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Citizens need a voice – we will work with local government to ensure that citizens’ needs are the driving force in the procurement and delivery of local services.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Electronic service delivery offers the prospect of greater convenience, access and quality, and we have set demanding targets for its use.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: When public services are delivered in partnership with the private and voluntary sectors, this should be on the basis of best value not worst labour standards.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The TUPE regulations protect the rights of any transferred employees.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Newly hired workers are protected by minimum standards at work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will use a wide-ranging review of TUPE regulations to consider whether unfair disparities are being created between these two groups of workers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to give successful local councils more leeway to meet local needs using a £400 million reward fund.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have piloted local public service agreements to offer new investment and greater financial flexibility in return for higher performance.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will extend this reform to all upper-tier councils.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will offer further flexibility for high-performance authorities, with reformed inspections and more local discretion to encourage civic renewal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We consulted last year on a range of reforms aimed at enabling councils to deliver key local services on the basis of transparent, stable and adequate funding.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: These remain our aims.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will give new freedoms to local authorities to enable them to invest in local capital projects.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour believes that local quality of life issues – from litter to parks – are vital issues, not peripheral.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will pilot home zones, redesigning local areas to enhance safety and the quality of the local neighbourhood.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Local authorities should have the incentive and means to improve the local environment by recycling local fines into a local environment fund.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ambition is the development of active, intouch local government, serving the people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support the introduction of elected mayors for our cities, which is why every local council now has the power to ballot citizens for a mayor.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Regional government
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Some functions are best tackled at the regional level.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic development is the core of regional policy today.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In our first term, we have created RDAs to drive regional economic development.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Regional chambers have been set up to provide some accountability for regional economic decision-making.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed, as RDAs take on more power, to enhance the scrutiny functions of regional chambers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For some regions this degree of political representation will be sufficient.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: However, in other parts of the country there may be a stronger sense of regional identity and a desire for a regional political voice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 we said that provision should be made for directly elected regional government to go ahead in regions where people decided in a referendum to support it and where predominantly unitary local government is established.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This remains our commitment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The nations of the UK
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Devolution has strengthened the UK, preserving the union on the basis of a fairer partnership.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The nationalist lie has also been exposed: the UK is strong enough and flexible enough to devolve power while retaining the benefits of staying together.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Scottish Parliament and the Welsh Assembly have put power in the hands of local people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In Scotland the Parliament has power over primary legislation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In Wales we will build on the already successful legislative partnership with the Assembly, and continue to enact specific legislation for Wales, where appropriate.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The UK Parliament makes the essential financial allocations to all devolved bodies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: English MPs make up 85 per cent of the UK Parliament so there is no case for threatening the unity of the UK with an English Parliament or the denial of voting rights to Scottish, Welsh and Northern Ireland’s MPs at Westminster.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Northern Ireland
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have made working for peace in Northern Ireland a priority.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Good Friday Agreement was overwhelmingly supported by the people of Northern Ireland and in the Republic of Ireland.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: While it has not brought a perfect peace, and while the peace process has not been smooth, it has made life immeasurably better.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Northern Ireland now has its own Assembly and Executive.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They have produced their first programme for government and first budget on a cross-community basis.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The security situation has been transformed.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: People can walk again on the streets of Belfast free from fear.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Troops no longer patrol in most of the province.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And the number of murders has been drastically reduced.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will build on these foundations to ensure that the Good Friday Agreement is implemented in full and the new institutions take root.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will establish a modern, responsive and fully accountable police service properly representative of the two main traditions in Northern Ireland and enjoying their trust and support.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And we will bring about the key reforms in the civil and criminal justice system which secure the respect and trust of both traditions.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Parliamentary reform
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The House of Commons is now more representative than ever before, yet only one in five MPs is a woman.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour increased women’s representation five-fold in the 1997 Parliament through all-women shortlists.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed, through legislation, to allow each party to make positive moves to increase the representation of women.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will continue to modernise the procedures of the House of Commons so it can effectively fulfil its functions of representation and scrutiny.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The government has introduced major innovations in the electoral systems used in the UK – for the devolved administrations, the European Parliament, and the London Assembly.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Independent Commission on the Voting System made proposals for electoral reform at Westminster.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will review the experience of the new systems and the Jenkins report to assess whether changes might be made to the electoral system for the House of Commons.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A referendum remains the right way to agree any change for Westminster.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to completing House of Lords reform, including removal of the remaining hereditary peers, to make it more representative and democratic, while maintaining the House of Commons’ traditional primacy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have given our support to the report and conclusions of the Wakeham Commission, and will seek to implement them in the most effective way possible.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour supports modernisation of the House of Lords’ procedures to improve its effectiveness.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will put the independent Appointments Commission on a statutory footing.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Whitehall
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our civil service is world-renowned for its independence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to maintaining the political impartiality of the civil service.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But it needs reform to make it more effective and more entrepreneurial.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There have been important reforms already.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to take further radical steps to ensure the civil service has the skills base necessary to meet the challenges set out in this manifesto.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Equal rights for all, proper enforcement of the law, and reformed structures of self-government: these are the foundations of a strong civic society.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour offers opportunity with responsibility – the right combination for Britain in the 21st century.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: How Labour is tackling crime:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by increasing police funding by 20 per cent over the next three years, and taking police numbers to record levels
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by targeting investment on fighting crime in the highest-risk areas and tough targets to reduce car crimes, burglaries and robberies
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by cracking down on local disorder and anti-social behaviour through local partnerships and measures to deal with the ‘yob culture’
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by implementing our ten-year strategy to tackle drugs, including tougher punishments for dealers
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by reforming the criminal justice system to deal with persistent offenders and ensuring the victims of crime have a greater say
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by tackling the causes of crime through measures like the New Deal and action on truancy
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 5. Britain strong in the world
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goals:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Europe to have the most competitive knowledge-based economies in the world, as British ideas lead a reformed and enlarged Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Delivering Kyoto and international development targets, as we help tackle climate change and global poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our next steps:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Lead economic reform in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Work for the re-start of world trade talks.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Strong, effective and responsive armed forces.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Raise international aid towards the UN target.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: - Be the first country to introduce greenhouse gas trading to cut pollution.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain needs a government ready to stand up for our interests and values.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have a ten-year vision for British foreign policy: a leading player in Europe, our alliance with the USA strengthened, using our global connections to help Britain and tackle global problems.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Unlike the Conservatives, we see Europe as an opportunity not a threat.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Because we participate fully, we are able to work with our partners to shape an EU agenda that advances our national interests.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will put democratically elected national governments in the driving seat of EU policy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our ten-year goal is to work with our partners for Europe to have the most competitive knowledge-based economies in the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We hold to our promise: no membership of the single currency without the consent of the British people in a referendum.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain has some of the best armed forces in the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour, they are being developed to meet the challenges of the post-Cold War world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to lead the development of a comprehensive agenda for poverty reduction and sustainable development.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to mobilise the international community to deliver the International Development Targets, generate growth and equity in developing countries, and help them benefit from global economic integration.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are convinced of the science of global warming.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We pledge to meet tough national targets for environmental protection, and we will work at international level to halt and reverse climate change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We face a choice between an inward-looking chauvinism that leads to isolation and a modern patriotism where the British national interest is pursued through international engagement.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Reform in Europe
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Europe is changing.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic reform is under way in the European Union, with over two million new jobs created last year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many new members are going to join the EU.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Co-operation is being extended in defence and security policy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A new way of conducting EU business has been born – comparing best practice to share the benefits of diversity in order to reduce over-reliance on centralised regulation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We face a very simple question.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Do we want to be part of the change, influencing its direction? Or do we want to opt out? We have spent 50 years on the margins; it is time to make the most of our membership.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have seen the alternative.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 1997 Britain had retreated into itself: business was global, people travelled and worked around the world, our culture was open to new ideas, yet our government was closing itself off.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And Britain got a worse deal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Because they were backward looking and divided on Europe, the Conservatives were weak and ineffective in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And because of their weakness in Europe, Britain lost influence around the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We lost our say over decisions that affected our lives.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the last four years we have seen the benefits of engagement.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our rebate has been protected and our contributions are falling to similar levels as France and Italy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Labour model of defence co-operation – giving Europe the option to act where NATO chooses not to – has won through.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic reform is now helping the European economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The veto on crucial issues of national sovereignty, such as tax, is safe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: All this happened only because Labour had the strength to get involved, argue for its ideas, and persuade others to follow us.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour believes that Europe brings benefits for Britain, and a Europe reformed by British ideas, working with our MEPs, will be even better for Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Together with virtually all other European countries we do not support a United States of Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we do believe a Europe made up of nation states and offering a unique blend of inter-governmental co-operation where possible and integration where necessary, can be a major force for good – for its own members and in the wider world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want to take Europe forward, to meet British needs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A Europe of prosperity
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Europe is a crucial market, accounting for more than half of our trade.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain has secured a shift in economic policy in Europe – away from harmonisation of rules and towards a system based on dynamic markets allied to comparison and promotion of best practice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The key priorities are: to deliver more choice and lower prices through liberalisation of financial services and utilities; to promote business development with a common EU patent and cuts in red tape; to develop our common research effort in frontier technologies like bioscience; to cut delays and fares by establishing an integrated Air Traffic Control system for Europe; and to develop effective labour market policy to tackle unemployment in dialogue with the social partners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support efforts being made across the EU to reform welfare states, modernise social partnership and advance social inclusion.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: EU state aid policy should bear down on aids that distort the single market while supporting economic modernisation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will keep the veto on vital matters of national sovereignty, such as tax and border controls.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Trade has been a vital source of prosperity for Europe’s citizens.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our vision is of an open European economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That requires a genuine single market, in an open world trading system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A wider Europe
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New countries joining the EU will give Britain a bigger market and Europe a bigger voice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Membership will help guarantee the freedoms of the new democracies in central and eastern Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is pledged to do all it can to enable the first group of applicant countries to join in time to take part in the next European Parliamentary elections in 2004.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is vital we ratify the Treaty of Nice which is essential to enlargement; Labour in government will do so.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservatives have said they will insist on tr ying to renegotiate Europe’s treaties at the first summit after the election.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: No other country agrees with this.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That means that a Conservative government would either have to back down in the face of opposition, or take Britain out of Europe altogether with disastrous consequences for Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our argument is that if Britain is stronger in Europe, it will be stronger in the rest of the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We reject the view of those who say we must choose between Europe and the USA.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We shall remain the USA’s firm ally and friend; but we are not going to turn our backs on Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The USA and Europe account for ten per cent of world population but 60 per cent of global GDP; working together we can tackle many problems and spread the benefits of freedom, peace and prosperity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A Europe of the future
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The main sources of popular legitimacy in Europe remain national governments and parliaments.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: So national governments should be seen to be setting the agenda of the EU, with the European Council setting the EU’s priorities, a strong independent Commission ensuring that the European interest is heard and enforced, and an effective European Parliament improving draft legislation and holding the Commission to account.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour wants the next Inter-governmental Conference in 2004 to address public concerns about the way the EU works, spelling out in a clear statement of principles what should and should not be done at European level.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour supports a stronger role for national parliaments in European affairs, for example in a second chamber of the European Parliament, with a particular remit to oversee the division of competences.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also insist that the Commission completes its internal reform programme.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Defence
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain’s national security is based on the mutual support that comes from membership of NATO.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That will not change.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And although Britain has rarely been more secure from foreign invasion, there are new threats to our people from crime and terrorism.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Instability around the world can affect us directly and we have a global responsibility to play our part in reducing international conflict, controlling the spread of weapons of mass destruction, and contributing to international peace-keeping and peace-making operations.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: To enable the European Union to act where NATO chooses not to, the EU should improve its military capabilities for humanitarian, peace-keeping and crisis management tasks.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our armed forces are the best in the world at fighting if they have to, and keeping the peace where they can.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to investing more in real terms in our armed services over the next three years, the first year-on-year real increase in funds for over a decade.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: An important part of that investment will be in better service accommodation.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are determined to recruit and retain the best people, from all walks of life and all backgrounds.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will look after the interests of Britain’s veterans.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have doubled funding for research on Gulf War illnesses, and will continue this important work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 Labour promised a strategic defence review.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Today, that review is admired around the world for its clarity, efficiency and foresight.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need more mobile and more flexible armed forces, with the ability to project force at distance and speed, to work closely with other nations and international bodies, and to fight and keep the peace.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have shown what this means in practice in Kosovo and Sierra Leone, and our servicemen and women have responded magnificently.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are determined to maximise resources for frontline use by disposing of surplus spares and promoting smart procurement and efficiency savings.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The European Defence Initiative is an important part of our defence policy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Europe spends two-thirds as much as the US on defence, but gets only a fraction of its effectiveness.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: European nations need to modernise their armed forces for rapid and flexible deployment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Improved EU military capabilities will not be separate from NATO structures and would only be deployed where NATO as a whole chooses not to engage.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The launch of an EU operation will follow a unanimous decision, with each member state free to decide whether to take part.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support Trident, Britain’s minimum nuclear deterrent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Nuclear Non- Proliferation Treaty commits us to work for the global elimination of nuclear weapons.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are enthusiastic signatories to the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty, whose coming into force will impede nuclear proliferation, and we want to see the USA and Russia continue to reduce their nuclear stockpiles.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We recognise the new dangers posed by the proliferation of nuclear, chemical and biological weapons, and the need to combat them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nuclear arms reductions and proliferation controls remain an important part of defence and security policy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will seek effective inspections against the development of chemical and biological weapons.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will encourage the US to consult closely with NATO allies on its ideas for missile defence, and to pursue dialogue with Russia on a new framework for strategic arms control that will encourage further cuts in nuclear weapons.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The British defence industry is a vital part of our economy, sustaining some 350,000 high-technology jobs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to work closely with our best companies to get the best equipment for our armed forces – a good deal for the taxpayer as well as a secure future for high-technology jobs.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The UK has introduced the most open report on arms exports of any European nation and has led the EU to adopt a code of conduct on arms sales.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will lead efforts to control the trade in small arms, and work for a comprehensive action plan at this year’s UN conference on small arms, including an international arms surrender fund to provide development aid in exchange for firearms.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will legislate to modernise the regulation of arms exports, with a licensing system to control the activities of arms brokers and traffickers wherever they are located.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work with EU applicant countries to strengthen their capacity to control legal and illicit arms transfers.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The modern world
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain belongs to a unique range of influential global organisations, giving us responsibilities and opportunities.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will stand up for Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • At the UN, where we support a more modern and representative Security Council, with more effective peace-keeping.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • At the Group of 7 leading industrialised countries, where we will stay at the forefront of efforts to promote development.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • In the Commonwealth, where we will work to promote human rights and bridge the digital divide.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will argue for an early, comprehensive world trade round, to the benefit of industrialised and developing countries alike.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The World Trade Organisation must be reformed, not rejected.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will support fairer terms of trade for developing countries, and a reduction in protectionism in the developed world in areas such as agriculture.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to help developing countries exercise their rights within the WTO.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We support the promotion of higher labour standards around the world, as well as respect for the environment, as we expand world trade.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The International Labour Organisation (ILO) is the place to set labour standards, but we believe there should be closer co-operation between the ILO and WTO through the creation of a joint standing forum of the two organisations.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to encouraging universal observance of human rights.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Governments that are democratically elected will be firmer allies for peace; open societies that respect individual freedom will be more reliable trade partners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will be a friend of those denied human rights and a supporter of steps to strengthen them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has played a leading role in bringing war criminals, notably from former Yugoslavia, to justice, and in establishing a permanent court to try war crimes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work to make the International Criminal Court a reality, with Britain as one of its first members.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: International development
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 Labour pledged to give new priority to tackling global poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Four years on, there have been real achievements – a cabinet minister heads an internationally respected department, the aid budget has been substantially raised, and tied aid abolished.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain is playing a leading world role on debt relief, education, HIV/AIDS, and in responding to humanitarian disasters.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With strong UK leadership, the international development effort is now increasingly focused on poverty reduction.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This is morally right, but also in our interest.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Many of the world’s biggest challenges – from violent conflict to rapid population growth to environmental threat – are caused or exacerbated by global poverty and inequality.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There can be no secure future for any of us unless we promote greater global social justice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will continue to focus Britain’s development effort on the achievement of the international development targets by 2015 – including halving the proportion of the world’s population living in extreme poverty, reducing child and infant mortality by two-thirds, primary education for all children, and sustainable development plans in every country.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: With Labour the aid budget will rise to 0.33 per cent of GNP by 2003-04, reaching £3.6 billion – a 45 per cent increase in real terms since 1997 level.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We remain committed to the UN target of 0.7 per cent of national income devoted to development and will make further substantial increases over the next Parliament.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We remain committed to our bill, blocked by the Tories, to consolidate our poverty-focused approach to development.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are using this aid to support political and economic reform in developing countries.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our aid is an investment to help countries put in place policies to raise the growth rate with greater equity, crack down on corruption, promote human rights, including for women and girls, and develop effective governance and democracy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will legislate to toughen controls over UK nationals who commit offences of corruption abroad.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour will champion increased effectiveness and a stronger focus on poverty reduction within international institutions – particularly the EU, but also the World Bank, IMF, UN and Commonwealth – with full support for poverty reduction strategies where they genuinely prioritise poverty reduction.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are committed to international action to put the needs of children at the centre of these strategies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By 2006 we want to raise to 70 per cent the proportion of EU aid going to low income countries, and work with the Commission, Parliament and other governments to strengthen the EU’s development effort.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour has led internationally on debt relief, providing 100 per cent relief for countries committed to spending the proceeds on poverty-reduction.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work to help more of the heavily indebted poor countries qualify for debt relief where this benefits the poor.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: And we will work to prevent new debt burdens through international agreement not to give export credits for excessive military spending or prestige projects.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Education has a special place for Labour.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will increase further our support for quality primary education for all, particularly for girls.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our Imfundo project, part of an £800 million education programme, will bring together public and private sector commitment to use IT to ensure effective teacher training and education management.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will give top priority to combating the spread of HIV/AIDS, which is inflicting massive human and economic costs across the developing world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work for the creation of a global health fund to make essential drugs and commodities more accessible to the poor, focusing on TB, malaria and HIV/AIDS.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This will complement our existing support for the development of basic healthcare systems, and our new tax credits to incentivise research by the drug companies into the diseases of poverty.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Development goes much wider than aid and debt relief.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is also about how we manage the global economy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our aim is to shape globalisation so that it works better for the world’s poor.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Trade is key but so is private investment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will promote socially responsible business practice through advisory services on codes of social responsibility, the ethical trading initiative, the Export Credit Guarantee Department’s new code of business principles, the Commonwealth Development Corporation’s partnership with the private sector, and our initiatives to encourage private investment in infrastructure.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Nowhere will our resolve be more tested than in Africa.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is committed to strengthening our partnership for development with Africa.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work with reforming governments, international institutions, the private sector and civil society in support of nationally owned development strategies.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will also redouble our efforts to prevent and resolve violent conflicts in Africa, using our new Africa conflict fund to provide help for security sector reform, demilitarisation programmes and tighter controls over small arms.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The environmental challenge
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The poor make the smallest per capita contribution to climate change, but are often most affected when it happens.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are convinced by the scientific evidence of climate change – and convinced that now is the time to act.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We need action at local, national and international level if we are to preserve the stability of our natural environment over the next 50 years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The principle of mutual responsibility that governs our approach to social problems also applies to environmental issues.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The healthy future of our environment is one of the world’s great challenges.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We must make substantial changes in the way we work and live to safeguard all our futures.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The UK played a leading role in the Kyoto conference.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions agreed at that conference are a vital first step in the battle against global warming.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It is critical that the whole international community plays its part in making a reality of sustainable development.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are determined to play a constructive role at the ‘Rio plus 10’ meeting in  South Africa next year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are one of the few countries to have met our 1992 obligations to hold greenhouse gases in 2000 below their 1990 levels.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In 1997 we set a target of reducing CO2 emissions by 20 per cent by 2010.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will meet our obligations arising from the Kyoto protocol and have set out a detailed strategy to achieve more – a 23 per cent cut in greenhouse gases by 2010.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Royal Commission on Environmental Pollution has said the UK will need to cut CO2 production by 60 per cent by 2050, so we need to press ahead with a radical agenda for the development of low carbon economic growth, embodied in our £700 million commitment to renewable energy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In addition to our proposals for environmental technology and renewable energy described in ‘Prosperity for all’, we must also make progress in the following areas:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • We must make the market work for the environment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain is developing the first national CO2 emissions trading system in the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It will help companies find the most efficient way of reducing emissions – and reward them for doing so.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Once the system is established here we will seek to extend it around the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • We will support hybrid and fuel cell vehicles, which already offer a halving of fuel consumption and CO2 emissions, with cheaper motoring to match – and for cleaner fuels and biofuels.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: By increasing demand for new technologies we can boost innovation and the vitality of the UK car industry.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • It is imperative that we use natural resources more efficiently and recycle more.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to tax pollution and reward clean production.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will develop environmental productivity indicators.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have set a target for the recycling of 35 per cent of household waste by 2015, and will work with all local authorities to introduce kerbside recycling schemes wherever appropriate.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Water management is a vital challenge for the future – for the environment and for the growing world population.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will continue to make our contribution at home: leakage is down by almost 30 per cent since 1997, bills have been cut by 12 per cent and disconnections have been ended.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • Environmental protection and sustainable development go hand in hand.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We cannot protect the environment without addressing the development needs of the poor, and poverty reduction depends on safeguarding natural resources on which poor people depend.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: • We will continue to provide leadership abroad, working for international agreement on climate change, improved integration of the environment in European policies and a strong global environment agency built around the current UN environment programme.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will work to improve marine and forest conservation overseas and in the UK.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Britain can be pivotal to world affairs, using our alliances to advance our interests and values.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The key is to use our strengths of history and geography to engage with other countries, not retreat.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: That is Labour’s promise.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: How labour is strengthening your voice in the world:
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by taking a lead in Europe, standing up for Britain’s rights and reforming Europe to promote jobs and deepen democracy
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by supporting our armed forces, making sure our troops are always available and effective in times of crisis
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by working to tackle global climate change, meeting our own tough targets and pushing other countries to meet theirs
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: by leading the fight against global poverty, with increased aid, better spent
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The choices for Britain
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: These are our ambitions for Britain – and how they can be achieved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Clear in our values, confident in our policies, we seek a new mandate from the British people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We are proud of our record in government.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But we are not yet satisfied.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Labour is the party of reform and we fight this election as agents of change in Britain.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Change to our economy, so more people share the benefits of growth.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Change in our public services, so that they better advance equality of opportunity.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Change in our welfare system, so that we extend security, responsibility and independence.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Change to tackle crime and its causes.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Change to deepen our democracy.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Change to Britain’s role in the world.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservatives were rejected in 1997 because they had failed.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The national debt had doubled; crime had doubled; we were 42nd in the world education league; one in five households was on benefit; and we were marginalised in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Yet instead of learning, the Conservatives have become more dogmatic, more extreme, more divided.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: They are worse than ever.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The British people now face a choice.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: New Labour stands in the political mainstream, rooted in the best values of the British people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Conservatives have veered to extreme positions.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This election will decide whether we continue the policies that have brought us economic stability, steady growth, investment in public services and targeted tax cuts for children and families, or whether we lurch back to boom and bust.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It will decide whether we put our schools, hospitals and police officers first, or put them second after unaffordable tax cuts.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It will decide whether we modernise the criminal justice system.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: It will decide whether we stand for a positive engagement with Europe and the wider world, or retreat to the sidelines.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We want everyone to vote in this election.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: But before you do, think of your job; think of your mortgage; think of your school and hospital; think of your children and your parents; think of police and crime prevention, think of the choice of leadership.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Think of who you want to succeed in Britain – the many or the few.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There is still much to do with new Labour – and a lot for you to lose under the Conservatives.
