title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The choice is clear: for an ambitious and confident Britain, the choice is Labour.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 25 steps to a better Britain
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 1 Basic skills for 750,000 people
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 2 Venture capital funds in every region
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 3 £180 billion investment in transport, with 25 local rail and train schemes

text: 4 Raise the minimum wage to £4.20

text: 5 £1,000 tax cut – the Children’s Tax Credit – for parents of newborn children
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 6 Every secondary school with a distinct ethos, mission or centre of excellence
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 7 Recruit an extra 10,000 teachers
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 8 More power to frontline staff
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 9 More health service workers – 20,000 more nurses, and at least 10,000 more doctors
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 10 Free access to national museums and galleries
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 11 An ‘Employment First’ interview for everyone coming on to benefits
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 12 Expanded support for children through tax and benefit reform
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 13 Extend and increase paid maternity leave and introduce paid paternity leave
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 14 New pension credit for lower- and middle-income pensioners and the Winter Fuel Payment retained
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 15 £900 million Neighbourhood Renewal Fund for jobs, education and crime prevention

text: 16 An extra 6,000 police recruits raising police numbers to their highest-ever level
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 17 Double the amount of assets seized from drug traffickers and other major criminals
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 18 Increased sentence plus education and drug treatment for persistent offenders
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 19 A bill of rights for victims
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 20 New freedoms with new targets for local government
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 21 Lead economic reform in Europe
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 22 Work for the re-start of world trade talks
title: Ambitions for Britain

title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 25 Be the first country to introduce greenhouse gas trading to cut pollution

text: The contract delivered
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In the 1997 Labour manifesto Tony Blair said: ‘We set out in the manifesto that follows ten commitments, commitments that form our bond of trust with the people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Judge us on them.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Have trust in us and we will repay that trust.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This is our contract with the people.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: ’ This is a summary of Labour’s record since 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For more information on Labour’s policies, please visit our website at www.labour.org.uk, or contact your local Labour campaign team.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 1. Education will be our number one priority, and we will increase the share of national income spent on education as we decrease it on the bills of economic and social failure.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: Key Stage 2 results for literacy and numeracy reached 75 per cent (up 12 per cent since 1997) and 72 per cent (up 10 per cent since 1997) in 2001.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: GCSE and A-level results have also improved.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: This September there will be no five-, six- and seven-year-olds in class sizes over 30.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have cut the costs of debt and unemployment by nearly £9 billion per year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Education spending has risen from 4.7 per cent of national income to 5 per cent this year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 2. There will be no increase in the basic or top rates of income tax.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: We cut the basic rate of income tax to 22p in April 2000 and introduced the 10p band in April 1999.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There has been no increase in the top rate of income tax.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The direct tax burden on a single earner family on average earnings with two children is the lowest since 1972.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 3. We will provide stable economic growth with low inflation and promote dynamic and competitive business and industry at home and abroad.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: Net borrowing in every year from 1997 to 2003-04 is forecast to be lower than in any Tory year from 1992-93 to 1996-97.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Inflation has been consistently under control and on target.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Economic growth has been steady, averaging 2.75 per cent a year since 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Living standards are on average about 10 per cent higher in real terms than in 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 4. We will get 250,000 young unemployed off benefit and into work.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: Over 280,000 unemployed young people have been helped into work by Labour’s New Deal.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There are over one million more jobs in the economy than in 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Youth unemployment now stands at its lowest level since 1975, longterm unemployment among under-25s is down 75 per cent.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Unemployment is at its lowest level for 25 years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 5. We will rebuild the NHS, reducing spending on administration and increasing spending on patient care.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: The next four years will see the biggest-ever sustained increase in NHS spending.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Over £1 billion will have been released from administration by next year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The NHS is treating 620,000 more in-patients and is seeing over 650,000 more outpatients than in 1996-97.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There are 17,100 more nurses and 6,700 more doctors than in 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: There are 124,000 fewer people on waiting lists.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 6. We will be tough on crime and tough on the causes of crime, and halve the time it takes persistent juvenile offenders to come to court.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: The British Crime Survey shows that overall crime fell by 10 per cent from 1997 to 1999.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Investment is now rising.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The time from arrest to sentence for persistent young offenders is down from 142 days to 89 days – on track to halve the time within the five years promised in 1997.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 7. We will help build strong families and strong communities, and lay the foundations of a modern welfare state in pensions and community care.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: Child benefit has been raised by over 25 per cent for the first child.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Children’s Tax Credit is worth up to £520 a year.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have introduced parental leave and rights to holidays.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have extended maternity leave.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: £4.5 billion extra in real terms is being spent this year on pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The basic state pension will rise to £75.50 for single pensioners and £120.70 for pensioner couples next year, while the minimum income guarantee is helping over 1.6 million of the poorest pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: TV licence fees have been abolished for the over-75s, with free access to national museums and galleries for children and pensioners.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 8. We will safeguard our environment, and develop an integrated transport policy to fight congestion and pollution.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: With the private sector, we will invest a record £180 billion in transport infrastructure over the next ten years.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We will achieve a 23 per cent cut in greenhouse gas emissions.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have legislated to promote protection for and access to the countryside.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: A £1.6 billion strategy for farming and rural enterprise will redirect subsidies to promote growth and the environment.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 9. We will clean up politics, decentralise political power throughout the United Kingdom and put the funding of political parties on a proper and accountable basis.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: The funding of political parties, campaign expenditure and conduct of referendums is now regulated.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: For the first time the UK has a Freedom of Information Act.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The Scottish Parliament, Welsh Assembly and Northern Ireland Assembly are now up and running, while local democracy has been returned to the people of London.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The first stage of reform of the House of Lords has reduced the number of hereditary peers to fewer than 100.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: 10. We will give Britain the leadership in Europe which Britain and Europe need.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: The record: Labour has negotiated successfully for Britain in Europe.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: Our rebate is protected, enlargement is being taken forward.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: We have led the debate on European economic reform and on the development of a European defence capacity rooted in NATO structures.
title: Ambitions for Britain

text: In Kosovo, our armed forces played a leading role in standing up against ethnic cleansing.
title: Ambitions for Britain
